This transmits revised IRM 1.31.3, CFO Internal Policy and Procedures, Procedures for the Certiﬁcations of Excise Tax Collections, Refunds and Credits.

These procedures are primarily for the program analysts and chief in the Custodial Reporting
Obtaining Treasury Concurrence of Changes to Excise Tax Certiﬁcations
the Certiﬁcations of Excise Tax Collections, Credits
) Purpose: This IRM provides procedures for the preparation of the quarterly refunds and credits and trust fund certiﬁcations. (
) Audience: These procedures are primarily for the program analysts and in the Custodial Reporting section. (
) Policy Owner: The Office of Custodial Accounting is within the Office of Financial Management (FM) Unit under the CFO. (
) Program Owner: The Custodial Reporting section is responsible for the cation of excise taxes. (

) Primary Stakeholders: Various IRS program offices, federal agencies, the ernmental Accountability Office (GAO), the Office of Tax Administration the Joint Committee on Taxation (JCT), the Congressional Budget Office (CBO) and the Bureau of the Fiscal Service. (
) Program Goals: To ensure the timely and accurate certiﬁcation of excise refunds and credits and excise tax collections. (
) Currently the Internal Revenue Code (IRC) provides for nine separate trust funds. The IRC Section and Trust Funds are: a. IRC Section
, Black Lung Disability Trust Fund b. IRC Section
, Airport and Airway Trust Fund c. IRC Section
, Highway Trust Fund d. IRC Section
, Sports Fish Restoration and Boating Trust Fund e. IRC Section
, Inland Waterways Trust Fund f. IRC Section
, Leaking Underground Storage Tank Trust Fund g. IRC Section
, Oil Spill Liability Trust Fund h. IRC Section
, Vaccine Injury Compensation Trust Fund i. IRC Section
, Patient-Centered Outcomes Research Trust Fund. (
) Taxpayers are required to ﬁle either a Form
, Quarterly Federal Excise Return, or Form
, Heavy Vehicle Use Tax Return (HVUT), reporting tax liability. The Form
reports the excise tax quarterly by abstract which identiﬁes the tax. The Form
reports taxes for the July
through June
period or for the period following a vehicle’s ﬁrst use. (
) Form
tax deposits are generally made semi-monthly with Form
, Federal Tax Deposit Coupon Book, or electronically through the Electronic Federal Tax Payment System (EFTPS). Semi-monthly deposits are required in advance of the return. (
) Under IRC Section

, Transfer of Amounts, excise taxes dedicated to trust funds must be transferred by the Bureau of the Fiscal Service, at least monthly, based on estimates by the Office of Tax Analysis, from the general fund to the trust fund. When the Bureau of the Fiscal Service receives the tiﬁcation reporting the actual collections for the affected quarter, are made to true-up the amounts transferred. (
) The Custodial Reporting Section is responsible for determining the trust fund collection credits and preparing both the collection and the Internal Revenue Manual

, Transfer of Amounts, excise taxes dedicated to trust funds must be transferred by the Bureau of the Fiscal Service, at monthly, based on estimates by the Office of Tax Analysis, from the fund to the trust fund. When the Bureau of the Fiscal Service receives the tiﬁcation reporting the actual collections for the affected quarter, are made to true-up the amounts transferred. The Custodial Reporting Section is responsible for determining the trust fund collection credits and preparing both the collection and the

Under IRC Section 9601, Transfer of Amounts, excise taxes dedicated to the trust funds must be transferred by the Bureau of the Fiscal Service, at least monthly, based on estimates by the Office of Tax Analysis, from the general fund to the trust fund. When the Bureau of the Fiscal Service receives the tiﬁcation reporting the actual collections for the affected quarter, adjustments are made to true-up the amounts transferred.
The Custodial Reporting Section is responsible for determining the amounts of trust fund collection credits and preparing both the collection and the refunds

CFO Internal Policy and and credits certiﬁcations. The collection certiﬁcation process is completed proximately ﬁve months after the end of the quarter or approximately four months after the return due date. (
) The trust fund collection certiﬁcations and refunds and credits certiﬁcations due to the Bureau of the Fiscal Service on the
st of February, May and August. If the

st is a non-work day, the due date is the next workday. Due GAO requirements, the end of ﬁscal year certiﬁcations have different due and are dependent on agreed upon dates decided during the IRS and the GAO pre-audit meetings held in February of each ﬁscal year. (

) To prepare the refunds and credits certiﬁcations, the analyst utilizes provided by the campuses and the Redesigned Revenue Accounting Control System (RRACS). To prepare the trust fund collection certiﬁcations, the utilizes information provided by IT, which is obtained from master ﬁle extracts of collections made during the previous quarter for all Form
returns on master ﬁles. (

Procedures for the Certiﬁcations of Excise Tax Collections, Refunds and Credits 1.31.3
The CFO and DCFO are responsible for establishing ﬁnancial policy for the management and reporting of the custodial assets.
The excise analysts are responsible for: a. Completing the quarterly trust fund certiﬁcation. b. Completing the quarterly refunds and credits certiﬁcation. c. Retrieving and saving the quarterly GAS-
Report of Credits, and Adjustments (Quarterly Treasury-
Report). d. Retrieving and saving the monthly
Report of Excise Tax Col- lections e. Retrieving and saving the monthly
Report of U.S. Internal Revenue Receipts. f. Retrieving and saving the monthly
Report of BMF Penalty lections g. Retrieving and saving the monthly
Report of IMF Penalty Col- lections. h. Retrieving and saving the monthly RRACS-

Report of Net Tax Revenue Refunds (NTRR). i. Retrieving and saving the monthly NMF Revenue Receipts report. j. Updating the NMF Revenue Receipts spreadsheet with the monthly data. k. Sending the updated NMF Revenue Receipts spreadsheet to Treasury. l. Updating the earmark workbook with the monthly data. m. Issuing the quarterly earmark letter to the Fish and Wildlife Service. n. Updating the HVUT spreadsheet with the monthly data. o. Issuing annual Branded Prescription Drug certiﬁcation letter to the of the Fiscal Service.
Program reports: Data sources include Control-D, Automated Quarterly Excise Tax Listing (AQETL) and Integrated Data Retrieval Systems (IDRS).

) Microsoft Excel: used to update the certiﬁcation workbooks. (
) Monarch software: used to consolidate data from multiple source reports. (
) Excise taxes reported and paid may also be credited or refunded. Credits refunds can be claimed on Form

, Credit for Tax Paid on Fuels, or Form
, Heavy Highway Vehicle Use Tax Return. these cases, IRS certiﬁes the amounts of the refunds paid or credits taken adjustments can be made to the trust funds. (

) An official certiﬁcation letter, signed by IRS management, is issued Treasury and the Bureau of the Fiscal Service documenting any refunds and/or credits claimed for excise taxes for the Airport and Airways Trust (
) The excise analysts use data from the following to prepare the certiﬁcation: a. GAS-
report of Credits, Claims and Adjustments (Quarterly Treasury-
Report), also known as the T-
Report, for each of the campuses which contain the quarterly amounts for credits, claims and adjustments by credit reference numbers for the following taxpayer documents: • Forms

, Quarterly Federal Excise Returns • Schedule C, Adjustments, ﬁled with Form
, Quarterly Federal Tax Returns b. RRACS Report
A, Net Tax Refund Report (NTRR). c. NTRR footnotes workbook. (

1.31 CFO Internal Policy and Procedures
There are 12 monthly tabs that make up the ﬁscal year NTRR Footnotes workbook. Historically, the tabs which require updating are as follows:
To update the corresponding tab, use the refund and credit certiﬁcation from the prior quarter for:
Section I

Use the amounts from the AATF consolidated recap tab and enter the amounts which correspond to the row titles and column headers. Section III – Use the amounts from the HTF consolidated recap tab and enter the amounts which correspond to the row titles and column headers. NTRR Footnote Data section – Existing formulas combine amounts from Section I and III. Enter the cumulative total amounts onto the Less Applied Footnotes line

) PCORTF Tab a. Per a MOU between IRS Financial Management and the Bureau of Fiscal Service, the PCORTF will not be certiﬁed on a quarterly basis to the unique ﬁling requirements for PCORTF entities. The IRS team will delay the PCORTF certiﬁcation until February/March of the following calendar year. This allows the certiﬁcation to be in sync OTA estimation and the Bureau of the Fiscal Service transfer
Change the dates in the body of the letter to reﬂect the proper liability and processing periods.

Per a MOU between IRS Financial Management and the Bureau of the Fiscal Service, the PCORTF will not be certiﬁed on a quarterly basis due to the unique ﬁling requirements for PCORTF entities. The IRS excise team will delay the PCORTF certiﬁcation until February/March of the following calendar year. This allows the certiﬁcation to be in sync with the OTA estimation and the Bureau of the Fiscal Service transfer processes.
Upon completion of the above steps, the preparer will assemble an electronic review package which contains the following:
Upon completion of the above steps, the preparer will assemble an electronic review package which contains the following: a. Entire trust fund certiﬁcation workbook. b. Coal credit workbook. c. HVUT
spreadsheet. d. Trust fund tax rates and distribution to accounts sheet. e.
, Report of BMF Penalty Collections. f.

, Report of IMF Penalty Collections. g. Review check sheets for preparer, team lead and chief. h. PDF versions of the trust fund certiﬁcation letters for electronic signature by the chief. The preparer will initial, date and electronically sign their check sheet prior to forwarding the review package to the team lead. If the team lead ﬁnds any discrepancies, the preparer is notiﬁed via email to make corrections. This continues until there are no discrepancies. Once all crepancies are resolved, the team lead will initial, date and electronically sign their check sheet and forward the package to the chief for review. The chief will review the package and initial, date and electronically sign their check sheet and the certiﬁcation letters. The check sheet and letters are returned to the team lead via email. The team lead will email the electronically signed letters and any supporting documentation to the appropriate parties according to the distribution list.

1.31 CFO Internal Policy and Procedures
) All source documentation, check sheets and electronically signed letters are retained on the excise shared drive for
years in accordance to IRS record retention standards. (

) This section establishes procedures to obtain concurrence from impacted Treasury agencies related to changes in how the IRS Excise Team manages and performs excise tax calculations or distribution processes. a. Prior to making any changes, the IRS Excise team will discuss the scenario with the potentially impacted Treasury offices. The offices this would most likely impact are the OTA and the Bureau of the Fiscal Service as they are responsible for the trust fund estimates and respectively. b. Upon obtaining documented concurrence from the OTA and the Bureau of the Fiscal Service for any changes to the certiﬁcation and distribution process, the IRS will issue a Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) taining director level signatures to document the agreement. c. The IRS Excise team will maintain an electronic folder of the MOUs on Excise shared drive.
All source documentation, check sheets and electronically signed letters are retained on the excise shared drive for 6 years in accordance to IRS record retention standards.
